definition_en: To become less intense or widespread.
example: The storm suddenly abated.

definition_en: A departure from what is normal, usual, or expected.
example: The outbreak of violence was an aberration.

definition_en: To regard with disgust and hatred.
example: I abhor all forms of racism.

definition_en: Experienced to the maximum degree (of something bad).
example: They live in abject poverty.

definition_en: The act of renouncing or rejecting something.
example: Monks practice abnegation of material possessions.

definition_en: Failing to produce the intended result.
example: An abortive attempt to overthrow the government.

definition_en: To shorten (a piece of writing) without losing the sense.
example: The book was abridged for children.

definition_en: To repeal or do away with (a law, right, or formal agreement).
example: The treaty was abrogated in 1929.

definition_en: To leave hurriedly and secretly, typically to avoid detection.
example: The cashier absconded with the money.

definition_en: Formal release from guilt, obligation, or punishment.
example: The priest granted him absolution.

definition_en: To restrain oneself from doing or enjoying something.
example: He abstained from alcohol.

definition_en: Difficult to understand; obscure.
example: An abstruse philosophical inquiry.

definition_en: To agree to a demand, request, or treaty.
example: The authorities did not accede to the strikers' demands.

definition_en: To make more noticeable or prominent.
example: Her dress accentuated her figure.

definition_en: An award or privilege granted as a special honor.
example: He received the highest accolade of his profession.

definition_en: (typically of speech or debate) angry and bitter.
example: An acrimonious divorce.

definition_en: The ability to make good judgments and quick decisions.
example: Business acumen.

definition_en: To warn or reprimand someone firmly.
example: She admonished him for drinking too much.

definition_en: Clever or skillful in using the hands or mind.
example: He was adroit at tax avoidance.

definition_en: Obsequious flattery; excessive admiration or praise.
example: He found it difficult to cope with the adulation of the fans.

definition_en: Difficulties; misfortune.
example: Resilience in the face of adversity.

definition_en: Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty.
example: The pictures give great aesthetic pleasure.

definition_en: Friendly, good-natured, or easy to talk to.
example: An affable and agreeable companion.

definition_en: Behavior, speech, or writing that is artificial and designed to impress.
example: The affectation of a man who measures every word.

definition_en: (especially of a group or area) having a great deal of money; wealthy.
example: The affluent societies of the western world.

definition_en: To increase the power, status, or wealth of.
example: An action intended to aggrandize the Frankish dynasty.

definition_en: Brisk and cheerful readiness.
example: She accepted the invitation with alacrity.

definition_en: To diminish or put at rest (fear, suspicion, or worry).
example: The report attempted to allay fears.

definition_en: To make (suffering, deficiency, or a problem) less severe.
example: He couldn't prevent her pain, only alleviate it.

definition_en: To suggest or call attention to indirectly; hint at.
example: She had a way of alluding to Jean but never saying her name.

definition_en: The belief in or practice of disinterested and selfless concern for the well-being of others.
example: Some may choose to work with vulnerable elderly people out of altruism.

definition_en: To combine or unite to form one organization or structure.
example: He amalgamated his company with another.

definition_en: (of language) open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning.
example: The question is rather ambiguous.

definition_en: Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone.
example: Some loved her, some hated her, few were ambivalent about her.

definition_en: To make (something bad or unsatisfactory) better.
example: The reform did much to ameliorate living standards.

definition_en: (of a person) open and responsive to suggestion; easily persuaded or controlled.
example: Parents who have had easy babies and amenable children.

definition_en: Having or displaying a friendly and pleasant manner.
example: An amiable, unassuming fellow.

definition_en: Without a clearly defined shape or form.
example: An amorphous, characterless conurbation.

definition_en: A thing belonging or appropriate to a period other than that in which it exists.
definition_cn: 时代错误；不合时宜的事物
example: Everything was as it would have appeared in centuries past apart from one anachronism, a bright yellow construction crane.

definition_en: Comparable in certain respects, typically in a way that makes clearer the nature of the things compared.
example: They saw the relationship between a ruler and his subjects as analogous to that of father and children.

definition_en: A state of disorder due to absence or nonrecognition of authority.
example: He must ensure public order in a country threatened with anarchy.

definition_en: A short and amusing or interesting story about a real incident or person.
example: Told anecdotes about his job.

definition_en: Strong hostility.
example: He no longer felt any animosity toward her.

definition_en: Something that deviates from what is standard, normal, or expected.
example: There are a number of anomalies in the present system.

definition_en: Active hostility or opposition.
example: The antagonism between the two brothers.

definition_en: A deep-seated feeling of dislike; aversion.
example: His fundamental antipathy to capitalism.

definition_en: Lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
example: Widespread apathy among students.

definition_en: To pacify or placate (someone) by acceding to their demands.
example: Amendments have been added to appease local pressure groups.

definition_en: Anxious or fearful that something bad or unpleasant will happen.
example: He felt apprehensive about going home.

definition_en: Approval or praise.
example: The opera met with high approbation.

definition_en: Based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system.
example: His mealtimes were entirely arbitrary.

definition_en: Understood by few; mysterious or secret.
example: Modern math and its arcane notation.

definition_en: Very old or old-fashioned.
example: Prisons are run on archaic methods.

definition_en: A very typical example of a certain person or thing.
example: The book is a perfect archetype of the genre.

definition_en: Involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring.
example: An arduous journey.

definition_en: (of a person or a person's words) having or showing the ability to speak fluently and coherently.
definition_cn: 清晰表达的；口齿伶俐的
example: An articulate account of their experiences.

definition_en: Clever or cunning devices or expedients, especially as used to trick or deceive others.
example: Artifice and intrigue.

definition_en: Characterized by or suggesting the practice of severe self-discipline and abstention from all forms of indulgence.
example: An ascetic life of prayer, fasting, and manual labor.

definition_en: Showing great care and perseverance.
example: She was assiduous in pointing out every feature.

definition_en: To make (an unpleasant feeling) less intense.
example: The letter assuaged the fears of most members.

definition_en: Having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people and turn this to one's advantage.
example: An astute businessman.

definition_en: (of body tissue or an organ) waste away, typically due to the degeneration of cells.
example: Without exercise, the muscles will atrophy.

definition_en: Showing a willingness to take surprisingly bold risks.
example: A series of audacious attacks.

definition_en: To make (something) greater by adding to it; increase.
example: He augmented his summer income by painting houses.

definition_en: Severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance.
example: An austere man, with a rigidly puritanical outlook.

definition_en: (of a country or region) having the freedom to govern itself or control its own affairs.
example: The federation included sixteen autonomous republics.

definition_en: Extreme greed for wealth or material gain.
example: He was rich beyond the dreams of avarice.

definition_en: A strong dislike or disinclination.
example: He had a deep-seated aversion to most forms of exercise.

definition_en: So lacking in originality as to be obvious and boring.
example: Songs with banal, repeated words.

definition_en: A cause of great distress or annoyance.
example: The bane of the decorator's existence.

definition_en: To fail to give a true notion or impression of (something); disguise or contradict.
example: His lively, alert manner belied his years.

definition_en: To make (someone or something) seem unimportant.
example: This is not to belittle his role.

definition_en: Hostile and aggressive.
example: A bull-necked, belligerent old man.

definition_en: Well meaning and kindly.
example: A benevolent smile.

definition_en: Gentle; kindly.
example: Her face was calm and benign.

definition_en: To leave (a personal estate or one's body) to a person or other beneficiary by a will.
example: He bequeathed his art collection to the town.

definition_en: To scold or criticize (someone) angrily.
example: His mother came out and berated him for raising his voice.

definition_en: Deprived of or lacking something, especially a nonmaterial asset.
example: Her room was stark and bereft of color.

definition_en: A flattering or pleasing statement or action used to persuade someone gently to do something.
example: The blandishments of the travel brochure.

definition_en: A thing that spoils or damages something.
example: The vacant properties are a blight on the neighborhood.

definition_en: To support or strengthen; prop up.
example: The fall in interest rates is starting to bolster confidence.

definition_en: High-sounding but with little meaning; inflated.
example: Bombastic rhetoric.

definition_en: Concise and exact use of words in writing or speech.
example: The staff will appreciate the brevity of the meeting.

definition_en: Abrupt or offhand in speech or manner.
example: She could be brusque and impatient.

definition_en: Relating to the pleasant aspects of the countryside and country life.
example: The church is lovely for its bucolic setting.

definition_en: To begin to grow or increase rapidly; flourish.
example: Manufacturers are keen to cash in on the burgeoning demand.

definition_en: A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.
example: A cacophony of deafening alarm bells.

definition_en: To persuade someone to do something by sustained coaxing or flattery.
example: He hoped to cajole her into selling the house.

definition_en: An event causing great and often sudden damage or distress; a disaster.
example: The journey had led to calamity and ruin.

definition_en: The quality of being open and honest in expression; frankness.
example: A man of refreshing candor.

definition_en: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
example: A capricious and often brutal administration.

definition_en: To reprimand (someone) severely.
example: He was castigated for not setting a good example.

definition_en: A person or thing that precipitates an event.
definition_cn: 催化剂；促使变化的人或事
example: The governor's speech acted as a catalyst for debate.

definition_en: Sarcastic in a scathing and bitter way.
example: The players were making caustic comments about the refereeing.

definition_en: Express severe disapproval of (someone or something), typically in a formal statement.
example: A judge was censured in 1983 for a variety of injudicious conduct.

definition_en: A person falsely claiming to have a special knowledge or skill; a fraud.
example: A self-confessed con artist and charlatan.

definition_en: To scold or rebuke.
example: She chided him for not replying to her letters.

definition_en: A factual written account of important or historical events in the order of their occurrence.
example: A vast chronicle of Spanish history.

definition_en: (of a route or journey) longer than the most direct way.
example: The canal followed a circuitous route.

definition_en: To restrict (something) within limits.
example: Their movements were strictly circumscribed.
